tool.name: Create3DGravityMains

param.name: InputFeatures
param.dialogReference: Select the gravity mains lines to convert to 3D.

param.name: UpperInvertElevation
param.dialogReference: Select the attribute that represents the upper invert elevation of the line segment.

param.name: LowerInvertElevation
param.dialogReference: Select the attribute that represents the lower invert elevation of the line segment.

param.name: InvertElevationUnit
param.dialogReference:
Set invert elevation unit for the selected upper and lower invert elevation attributes.

Note: a new field will be added to the feature class converting the invert elevation values to the linear units of the input layer. If no units are specified, invert elevation units are considered the same as the linear units.

param.name: Diameter
param.dialogReference:
Select the attribute that represents the diameter of the line segment. This attribute is used to calculated the correct elevation for the segment together with the invert attributes.

Note: make sure the diameter units are the same as the segment elevation units

param.name: DiameterUnit
param.dialogReference:
Set diameter unit for the selected diameter attribute.

Note: a new field will be added to the feature class converting the diameter values to the linear units of the input layer. If no units are specified, diameter units are considered the same as the linear units.

param.name: DefaultDiameter
param.dialogReference: Use this value if there is no diameter attribute or no Null values or negative values in the the diameter attribute.

param.name: OutputFeatures
param.dialogReference: Set the name for the output feature class.

param.name: OutputAs3DObjects
param.dialogReference: Toggle on if you want to output 3D objects as well as 3D lines.

param.name: UseNearbyPointsForElevation
param.dialogReference:
If no values are found for upper or lower invert elevation, use nearby points to set elevation. E.g. if no lower invert elevation is found, see if neighboring segemtns have upper invert elevations.

Note: segments that used elevation values from nighboring segments will get an error code attribute of 2 and colored yellow.

param.name: Treat0asError
param.dialogReference: Toggle on if the value of 0 in the upper and lower elevaton attributes is to be treated as an error.

param.name: ErrorElevationValue
param.dialogReference:
Set the elevation value to use if the upper or lower elevation is not known

Note: segments will get an error code attribute of 1

param.name: InterpolateErrors
param.dialogReference:
Toggle on if you want to interpolate invert elevations based on the known good invert elevation values in the dataset.

Note: a surface will be intepolated through the known good invert elevations. Segment vertices with Null or 0 values (if 0 is consifered to be an error) will be interpolated on to that surface and receive an error code of 2.

tool.summary:
Creates 3D gravity mains lines from 2D and 3D gravity mains lines with start invert and end invert elevation attributes.

Note: when the input are 3D lines, the 3D geometry is ignored and recreated from the attributes
